description: During my graduate study at Purdue, I have acquired a deeper understanding of computer science fundamentals, such as compiler design and implementation, systems programming, and algorithmic analysis. I have also joined Purdue's Capture the Flag team, where I'm learning about reverse engineering, web exploitation, binary exploitation, and cryptography. My cumulative GPA is yet to be calculated (it is currently my first semester).

During my undergraduate years at Ball State, I learned the foundations of computer science, such as basic programming practices/concepts, computer architecture, algorithm analysis, networking, databases, and software engineering. I graduated summa cum laude with a 3.94 GPA in May 2021.
